get.summary: Get a quote of the current CARBON price in USD.
get.description:
Request a price quote for any amount of CARBON.

The response includes the total cost of the requested amount, as well as the average price
per CARBON. Both are denominated in USD.

This quote is non-binding and does not take into account the amount of CARBON that we are
currently able to provide from our pool.

parameters.name: carbon_amount

schema.description: requested amount of CARBON
schema.title: Carbon Amount

parameters.description: requested amount of CARBON

400.description: Horizon transaction has failed or is malformed

500.description: An unhandled error occurred on the server

410.description: Data requested from Horizon is before recorded history

503.description: Horizon's historical database is too stale

504.description: Horizon could not confirm transaction inclusion (check network conditions)

parameters.name: usd_amount

schema.description: requested amount of USD
schema.title: Usd Amount

parameters.description: requested amount of USD

500.description: An unhandled error occurred on the server

410.description: Data requested from Horizon is before recorded history

503.description: Horizon's historical database is too stale

504.description: Horizon could not confirm transaction inclusion (check network conditions)

post.summary: Build the XDR for a new CARBON sinking transaction.
post.description:
An offset is done by atomically swapping CARBON for CarbonSINK. This endpoint can be used to
build the XDR for such a sinking transaction.

If the funder does not have a sufficient balance of CARBON, a path payment will be used to
purchase the exact amount of CARBON to be retired. The most favorable rate will be selected
from the possible paths. The USDC value of this payment is included in the response for
convenience, but it is advisable to always check the generated XDR before signing and
submitting it to the network.

parameters.name: funder

schema.description: public key of the account that pays for the transaction
schema.title: Funder

parameters.description: public key of the account that pays for the transaction

parameters.name: recipient

schema.description: public key of the account that will receive CarbonSINK (default: funder)
schema.title: Recipient

parameters.description: public key of the account that will receive CarbonSINK (default: funder)

parameters.name: carbon_amount

schema.description: the amount of CARBON to sink
schema.title: Carbon Amount

parameters.description: the amount of CARBON to sink

parameters.name: payment_asset

schema.description: the preferred asset to pay with when the funder does not have a sufficient CARBON balance
schema.title: Payment Asset

parameters.description: the preferred asset to pay with when the funder does not have a sufficient CARBON balance

parameters.name: vcs_project_id

schema.description: carbon project from which credits will be retired
schema.title: Vcs Project Id

parameters.description: carbon project from which credits will be retired

parameters.name: memo_type

schema.description: the kind of memo that will be attached to the transaction
schema.title: Memo Type

parameters.description: the kind of memo that will be attached to the transaction

parameters.name: memo_value

schema.description: description of the reason for offsetting
schema.title: Memo Value

parameters.description: description of the reason for offsetting

parameters.name: email

schema.description: email address that will receive the Verra certificate (also supports `Your Name <account@domain.xyz>` format)
schema.title: Email

parameters.description: email address that will receive the Verra certificate (also supports `Your Name <account@domain.xyz>` format)

400.description: No payment path was found for this Stellar account

500.description: An unhandled error occurred on the server

410.description: Data requested from Horizon is before recorded history

503.description: Horizon's historical database is too stale

504.description: Horizon could not confirm transaction inclusion (check network conditions)

404.description: Stellar account was not found on the Public Global Stellar Network ; September 2015

get.summary: Get the list of Stellarcarbon retirements in the Verra Registry.
get.description:
Fetch the list of finalized CARBON retirements from the Verra Registry.

Return all retirements made to the Carbon Sink in the Verra Registry. All information on the
retired instruments and their retirement events is directly copied from Verra. We have added
a `total_amount_retired` field for convenience, to be able to quickly access the number of
tonnes for which Stellarcarbon has finalized their retirement in the registry.

This endpoint can be slow to respond due to the upstream query that is done in the Verra Registry.

parameters.name: for_address

schema.description:
Optionally filter the retirements list by Stellar address.

This filter does not affect any of the aggregate statistics. Any filtered 
statistics need to be computed by the client making the request.
schema.title: For Address

parameters.description:
Optionally filter the retirements list by Stellar address.

This filter does not affect any of the aggregate statistics. Any filtered 
statistics need to be computed by the client making the request.

parameters.name: date_gte

schema.description: Only list retirements done on or after this date.
schema.title: Date Gte

parameters.description: Only list retirements done on or after this date.

400.description: The request you sent was invalid in some way

500.description: An unhandled error occurred on the server

504.description: Timeout querying the Verra Registry (8 seconds)

get.summary: Get the list of Stellarcarbon inventory batches in the Verra Registry.
get.description:
Show Stellarcarbon's inventory held in the CARBON Pool in the Verra Registry.

Return all batches of credits that are held in the CARBON Pool sub-account. These batches
include credits that can still be used as well as credits that have been sunk through
Stellarcarbon but whose retirement has yet to be finalized in the Verra Registry, e.g.
because of incomplete fractional retirements.

The field `total_inventory_credits` contains the sum of all batches in the inventory.

400.description: The request you sent was invalid in some way

500.description: An unhandled error occurred on the server

504.description: Timeout querying the Verra Registry (5 seconds)
